definition: to choose/to pick/to sort out/to pick up
"hand" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 64), occurring in 提, 把, 打 etc
abbr. for 柬埔寨[Jian3 pu3 zhai4], Cambodia
to choose which Buddha to burn incense to (idiom); fig. to curry favor from the right person
to choose one's food carefully/to be picky
a cheap choice/to choose sth that costs nothing
to browse and select/to glance through and check
the God of Thunder strikes bean curd, a bully picks the weakest person/to pick on an easy target
pinyin: Lei2 Gong1 da3 dou4 fu5 , jian3 ruan3 de5 qi1

sentences.english: Sb. could fall into shit and come up smelling of roses !
sentences.chinese: 那傢伙運氣特別好，掉進糞坑裏還能揀個金元寶。

sentences.english: He spent only 300 dollars in the car, which was simply a steal.
sentences.chinese: 這部車他只是花了300美元，跟白揀的一樣。

sentences.english: Now is a time to pick up bargains.
sentences.chinese: 現在是揀便宜貨的時候了。

sentences.english: When I grew a little bigger, I went out to collect the waste copper, iron, and broken glass to sell.
sentences.chinese: 再長大些，我就揀些廢銅爛鐵和碎玻璃什麼的去賣。

sentences.english: He scrambled widely to pick up the broken glasses before his guests could see them.
sentences.chinese: 他手忙腳亂地去揀摔壞了的眼鏡片，免得讓客人看見。

sentences.english: After the storm she gathered a basketful of windfalls in the apple orchard.
sentences.chinese: 風暴當時，她從蘋果園地上揀了滿滿一籃子蘋果。

sentences.english: He had to pick the leaves up .
sentences.chinese: 他只好把樹葉子揀起來。

sentences.english: They are sorting out the wheat from the chaff.
sentences.chinese: 他們正在把小麥從糠皮中揀出來。

sentences.english: Pick up your socks and put them in the laundry basket.
sentences.chinese: 把你的襪子揀伏回，擱到洗衣籃表。

sentences.english: When he bends to pick it up, he knocks over his portfolio and papers fall out.
sentences.chinese: 當他彎身去揀時，又撞翻了公文包，文件散落一地。

sentences.english: Another essential condition for a weak army fighting a strong one is to pick out the enemy's weaker units for attack.
sentences.chinese: 弱軍對於強軍作戰的再一個必要條件，就是揀弱的打。

sentences.english: Give Timely Help and Do a Good Deed Everyday. I Donate Confidently.
sentences.chinese: 雪中送炭，日行一善，捐贈對象我識揀。

sentences.english: But, as Zhu Dan reports, one of the toughest jobs is for the youngsters charged with making sure the balls keep rolling.
sentences.chinese: 但是，朱丹認爲，最辛苦的還是場上揀球的球童。

sentences.english: She wondered why we had picked on that small room to work in.
sentences.chinese: 她不知道爲什麼我們偏要揀中那個小房間作爲工作室。

sentences.english: Apparently taking up another subject, she recommenced in a short time.
sentences.chinese: 停一會她又開始說了，顯然是另揀一個題目。

sentences.english: The snake wouldn't budge an inch until the Duke picked up the pearl and put it in his pocket.
sentences.chinese: 那條蛇一動不動直到侯爺把珍珠揀起來放到口袋裏。

definition: to calculate/to compute/to count/to regard as important/to plan/ruse/meter/gauge
to select/to choose/to pick over/to pick out/to differentiate/to eliminate/also pr. [zhai2]
to count/to count as/to regard as/to enumerate (sb's shortcomings)
to speak/to explain/to negotiate/to emphasise/to be particular about/as far as sth is concerned/speech/lecture
two/both/some/a few/tael, unit of weight equal to 50 grams (modern) or 1⁄16 of a catty 斤[jin1] (old)
to fight over/to rush/to scramble/to grab/to rob/to snatch
to know/to reprimand/to urge/to long for/to tell/to inform
tight/strict/close at hand/near/urgent/tense/hard up/short of money/to tighten
suffix of a noun of locality
only/merely/no more than/but/however/anyway (to get back to a previous topic)/cannot be more (after adjectival)
